byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone and William J. Broad contributed reporting from New York, Peter Baker from Washington, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

abstract: United States and European nations lift economic and oil sanctions on Iran after inspectors conclude nation has complied with requirement that it dismantle large part of its nuclear program; announcement comes on day of diplomatic tensions on which five American prisoners are freed by Iran in exchange for release of Iranian detainees.
lead_paragraph: Iran has shipped most of its nuclear fuel out of the country, destroyed the innards of a plutonium-producing reactor and mothballed more than 12,000 centrifuges.

headline.main: Iran Complies With Nuclear Deal; Sanctions Are Lifted
headline.print_headline: Iran Meets Terms of Nuclear Deal, Ending Sanctions

snippet: Iran has shipped most of its nuclear fuel out of the country, destroyed the innards of a plutonium-producing reactor and mothballed more than 12,000 centrifuges.
